III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112: Staff Qualifications
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
Description following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Unknown male staff is raping Youth A at the facility daily and staff
are “hitting” on her.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 3/6/25.
Complainant reported Youth A was raped by a male staff every
day and staff were hitting on her (flirting). Complainant reported
Youth A did not provide her any details to these allegations.
Complainant reported she has never seen any staff act
inappropriately towards Youth A. Complainant reported Youth A
has been in and out of the facility since 2/7/25 due to self-harming
behaviors. Youth A has been at the hospital and not at the facility.
Due to this, the allegations do not make sense, because Youth A
is not at the facility daily. Complainant reported Youth A has made
numerous allegations with the intentions to be removed from the
facility. Complainant reported Youth A is usually on a 1:1 staffing
when she returns from the hospital, which means that only female
staff are allowed to supervise her. Complainant 1 reported Youth
A is known to fabricate things.
Administrator was interviewed on 3/7/25 at the facility.
Administrator reported Youth A has not been at the facility daily
but at the hospital. Administrator reported Youth A was at the
facility from 2/1/25-2/9/25 and 3/3/25-3/6/25. All other days she
was hospitalized due to self-harming behaviors. Administrator
reported when youth are placed on a 1:1 staffing, the staff
supervising are normally female. Administrator reported there
would not be a time that only one male is staffing the girl’s unit.
Administrator reported there are no grievances filed by Youth A.
The following interviews were conducted at the facility with
MDHHS Worker on 3/20/25.
Initially Youth A was to be interviewed at Kids Talk on 4/1/25, but
due to her recanting allegations, the Kids Talk was cancelled.
Youth A reported she has never been sexually abused by a staff
at the facility. Youth A reported she has never been with any male
2

staff on the unit alone. Youth A reported no staff has ever touched
her in an inappropriate way. Youth A reported every time she has
been on a 1:1 it has been a female staff. Youth A reported no staff
has ever flirted with her or “hit on her.”
Staff 1 and Staff 2 both reported they work on Youth A’s unit.
Both reported they have never witnessed or heard about any staff
sexually assaulting Youth A. Both reported they have never heard
any staff, including themselves flirt with Youth A. Both reported
Youth A is frequently on 1:1 staffing and male staff do not
supervise female 1:1 supervision. Both reported they have never
seen a male on her 1:1 supervision. Both reported male staff are
not left alone with the youth on the unit. Staff 1 additionally
reported it would be impossible to sexually assault a youth due to
cameras everywhere in the unit.
Youth B reported she is on the same unit as Youth A. Youth B
reported she has never heard anyone state they have been raped
on the unit. Youth B reported she has not seen anyone raped on
the unit. Youth B reported she has never seen male staff enter
into Youth A’s bedroom. Youth B reported when a youth is on a
1:1 staffing, only female staff are allowed to monitor the youth.
Youth B reported she has never heard any staff flirt with or “hit on”
youth in the program.
Documents Reviewed:
• I reviewed the Staff and Client Interaction policy.
…Male staff are not to make visual checks of a resident’s
room…Staff members should never present themselves in
a manner that could be construed as flirtatious or sexual in
nature to clients.
• I reviewed Youth A’s hospitalization dates through Youth
A’s Demographics document. Youth A was at the hospital
from 2/9/25-2/20/25. On 2/20/25, she returned to the facility
and then was taken back to the hospital and stayed there
until 3/3/25.
• There are no 1:1 observation for 2/1/25-2/8/25 and 3/3/25-
3/6/25; therefore, Youth A was with her group when she
returned from the hospital.
• There are no grievances filed by Youth A.
Analysis The agency is found compliant with this rule. Youth A reported she
was not sexually assaulted nor verbally flirted with by staff. Staff 1,
Staff 2, and Youth B all reported they have never heard or seen
anyone sexually assault or flirt with Youth A.
3

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical Assistance was provided for R.400.4407: Facility and
premises maintenance. Inside the facility building, there were
multiple plywood boards screwed to the walls due to damage. This
damage was caused by the youth housed in the building. Based
on an interview with Administrator 2 on 3/28/25, the plywood has
been there for about a month. Due to the current destructive
behavior of the youth, they were planning on keeping the plywood
up until they were able to change the culture. It was discussed
that the plywood is not considered “sound and in good repair” as
outlined in R.400.4407. Although it may take time to fix the
damaged caused by the youth, the agency cannot wait until the
culture of the youth is less destructive to make the necessary
repairs. The agency is to come up with a date that they will make
the necessary repairs and provide this to their assigned
consultant.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: The Michigan Department of Health and Human Services investigated allegations of a male staff member sexually assaulting a youth daily and staff flirting with her at the Vista Maria facility. The investigation found the allegations unsubstantiated, as the youth recanted her claims, multiple interviews and document reviews contradicted the initial report, and the youth's frequent hospitalizations made the alleged daily assaults implausible. Based on the evidence gathered, the facility was found to be in compliance with all applicable rules, with no substantial violations identified. The facility's staff is cleared of wrongdoing in this matter.
